title: Disabled girl forced to climb stairs to take exam, MP human rights group seeks report | india-news | Hindustan Times
text:
Disabled girl forced to climb stairs to take exam, MP human rights group seeks report india Updated: Feb 14, 2017 22:12 IST Bhopal The office of the Madhya Pradesh Public Service Commission in Indore.(HT file ) 
The Madhya Pradesh human rights body has sought a report from the state public service commission about a physically-challenged girl climbing stairs to reach her seat during an exam conducted by the latter two days ago. 
Taking suo motu cognisance of news reports in this regard, the Madhya Pradesh Human Rights Commission (MPHRC) has sought an explanation from the Secretary of Madhya Pradesh Public Service Commission (MPPSC). 
“The MPHRC has asked the MPPSC Secretary to submit a report over news that a physically-challenged girl was forced to climb about two dozen staircases to reach her seat in the exam hall,” MPHRC Public Relations Officer L R Sisodiya said on Tuesday. 
The incident took place during MPPSC preliminary exam held on February 12 at SATI Exam Centre in Vidisha, about 50km from the state capital. 
Sisodiya said the MPPSC Secretary has been asked as to why necessary arrangements for the physically challenged candidates were not made at exam centres. 
“We have also sought information about arrangements of ‘writers’ made for the visually-impaired candidates who appeared in this exam,” he said. tags
